response.original_title: New York Support: Resolving Kaspersky "Database Corrupted" and NTFS Permission Hijacks
response.overview: NY Technical Help Desk: 1-855-508-8955 Technical Root Cause Analysis: In New Yorkâ€™s corporate environments, the "Database Corrupted" error is often a sign of an NTFS Permission Hijack. 2026 malware attempts to disable Kaspersky by changing the Security Descriptors of the C:\ProgramData\Kaspersky Lab folder to "Read-Only" for the System account. This prevents the antivirus from updating its virus definitions, making the database appear corrupted or outdated to the UI. Advanced Restoration Protocols: ACL (Access Control List) Reset: Use the icacls command to restore "Full Control" permissions to the Kaspersky service accounts. Update Proxy Flush: Clear any malicious proxy settings in the Kaspersky network config that are redirecting updates to a dead server. Temp Binary Purge: Delete the \Bases\Temporary folder contents to remove the corrupted update fragments.
response.tagline: New York Support: Resolving Kaspersky "Database Corrupted" and NTFS Permission Hijacks
response.title: New York Support: Resolving Kaspersky "Database Corrupted" and NTFS Permission Hijacks
